title: Three-quarters of college students back impeachment inquiry: poll
text:
More than three-quarters of college students support House Democrats in their impeachment inquiry into President Trump Donald John TrumpBusiness school deans call for lifting country-specific visa caps Bolton told ex-Trump aide to call White House lawyers about Ukraine pressure campaign: report Federal prosecutors in New York examining Giuliani business dealings with Ukraine: report MORE, according to a poll released Tuesday.

The Axios/College Reaction Poll found that 76 percent of college students say they support the inquiry, a more than 20 percent jump from 52 percent who said the same in late May.

ADVERTISEMENT

The results were divided heavily along party lines, as 97 percent of students who identified as Democrats said they supported the investigation while only 22 percent who identified as Republicans said the same. Among students identifying as independent, 76 percent said they support the probe.

Researchers surveyed 850 students between Oct. 8-10. The results have a margin of error of plus or minus 3.3 percentage points.

House Democrats have launched an impeachment inquiry into Trump following revelations that he pushed Ukraine to investigate Democratic presidential frontrunner Joe Biden Joe BidenSupport drops for Medicare for All but increases for public option Bolton told ex-Trump aide to call White House lawyers about Ukraine pressure campaign: report Federal prosecutors in New York examining Giuliani business dealings with Ukraine: report MORE and his son, Hunter. Trump has since publicly asked Ukraine and China to investigate the Bidens.

The president has denied any wrongdoing in the requests and has blasted the inquiry as a “witch hunt.”

Other polling in recent weeks has also a majority or plurality of Americans supporting the inquiry.
description: More than three-quarters of college students support House Democrats in their impeachment inquiry into President Trump, according to a poll released Tuesday.
